Name: oid
Description: row identifier (hidden attribute; must be explicitly selected)

Name: amname
Description: name of the access method

Name: amstrategies
Description: number of operator strategies for this access method, or zero if access method does not have a fixed set of operator strategies

Name: amsupport
Description: number of support routines for this access method

Name: amcanorder
Description: does the access method support ordered scans sorted by the indexed column's value?

Name: amcanorderbyop
Description: does the access method support ordered scans sorted by the result of an operator on the indexed column?

Name: amcanbackward
Description: does the access method support backward scanning?

Name: amcanunique
Description: does the access method support unique indexes?

Name: amcanmulticol
Description: does the access method support multicolumn indexes?

Name: amoptionalkey
Description: does the access method support a scan without any constraint for the first index column?

Name: amsearcharray
Description: does the access method support scalararrayopexpr searches?

Name: amsearchnulls
Description: does the access method support is null/not null searches?

Name: amstorage
Description: can index storage data type differ from column data type?

Name: amclusterable
Description: can an index of this type be clustered on?

Name: ampredlocks
Description: does an index of this type manage fine-grained predicate locks?

Name: amkeytype
Description: type of data stored in index, or zero if not a fixed type

Name: aminsert
Description: "insert this tuple" function

Name: ambeginscan
Description: "prepare for index scan" function

Name: amgettuple
Description: "next valid tuple" function, or zero if none

Name: amgetbitmap
Description: "fetch all valid tuples" function, or zero if none

Name: amrescan
Description: "(re)start index scan" function

Name: amendscan
Description: "clean up after index scan" function

Name: ammarkpos
Description: "mark current scan position" function

Name: amrestrpos
Description: "restore marked scan position" function

Name: ambuild
Description: "build new index" function

Name: ambuildempty
Description: "build empty index" function

Name: ambulkdelete
Description: bulk-delete function

Name: amvacuumcleanup
Description: post-vacuum cleanup function

Name: amcanreturn
Description: function to check whether index supports index-only scans, or zero if none

Name: amcostestimate
Description: function to estimate cost of an index scan

Name: amoptions
Description: function to parse and validate reloptions for an index
